message.content:
We need to calculate five ratios. To do so we must first determine the “average” balances for accounts that start with a zero initial balance (such as Accounts Receivable) and the average of beginning and ending total assets.

Step 1. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio 
• Formula: Sales / Average Accounts Receivable 
• Sales (from income statement): Main Business Revenue = 28,572,608.70 
• Accounts Receivable:
  Beginning (2023-12-31) = 0.00 
  Ending (2024-02-05) = 14,921,566.06 
  Average = (0 + 14,921,566.06) / 2 = 7,460,783.03 
• Ratio = 28,572,608.70 / 7,460,783.03 ≈ 3.83

Step 2. Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio 
• Formula: Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Total Current Liabilities 
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities (from cash flow statement) = –10,442,735.47 
• Total Current Liabilities (from balance sheet) = 8,028,630.43 
• Ratio = –10,442,735.47 / 8,028,630.43 ≈ –1.30

Step 3. Operating Cash Flow Ratio 
Often this is taken as the operating cash flow divided by current liabilities. (Note: In the example both operating cash flow ratio and operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio were the same.)  
• Thus, we again get –1.30

Step 4. Total Asset Turnover Ratio 
• Formula: Revenue / Average Total Assets 
• Total Assets: 
  Beginning (2023-12-31) = 28,000,000.00 
  Ending (2024-02-05) = 39,772,748.32 
  Average = (28,000,000.00 + 39,772,748.32) / 2 = 33,886,374.16 
• Ratio = 28,572,608.70 / 33,886,374.16 ≈ 0.84

Step 5. Debt to Equity Ratio 
• Formula: Total Liabilities / Total Owner’s Equity 
• Total Liabilities: (here only current liabilities are provided) = 8,028,630.43  
• Total Owner’s Equity (from balance sheet, end date) = 31,744,117.89 
• Ratio = 8,028,630.43 / 31,744,117.89 ≈ 0.25

As requested, the solution in JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "3.83",
    "operating cash flow ratio": "-1.30",
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-1.30",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.84",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.25"
  }
}
